result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Motion for Extension of Time to File Motions to Suppress, filed by Atty. Jurek

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 23, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Demand for Discovery and Disclosure, filed by Atty. Jurek

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Court will allow defendant to use/possess and transport a firearm to any approved CCW course for the purposes of obtaining that license but Defendant is not to go armed outside that class.

8:59 AM Defendant Samuel M Clough in court.  Attorney Anthony John Jurek in court for Samuel M Clough. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
